sentences.en: And they will have to strengthen the IMF as their ultimate safeguard.
sentences.cn: 他们还必须巩固国际货币基金组织,作为他们最后的保障.

sentences.en: As a further safeguard of the popular interest, progressives championed the recall.
sentences.cn: 进步派为进一步保护公众利益而提倡罢免权.

sentences.en: As a safeguard Sultan ceded Rembau and Linggi to the Dutch.
sentences.cn: 苏丹把林茂和林吉割让给荷兰人,以作保证.

sentences.en: As an additional safeguard against weeds you can always use an underlay of heavy duty polyethylene.
sentences.cn: 作为另外一种预防杂草的防护措施，你可以一直使用一层厚重耐磨的聚乙烯底垫。
保险会使你的财产得到保障.

sentences.en: International safeguards prevent the increase of nuclear weapons.
sentences.cn: 国际安全条约防止核武器数量增加。

sentences.en: Keeping clean is a safeguard against disease.
sentences.cn: 保持清洁是抵御疾病的防护措施.

sentences.en: Lily's only safeguard is that Bertha needs her badly.
sentences.cn: 丽莉手中唯一的王牌是白莎非常非常需要她.

sentences.en: Many people took second jobs as a safeguard against unemployment.
sentences.cn: 许多人为防失业都干两份工作。

sentences.en: safeguards against the exploitation of children
sentences.cn: 避免儿童遭受剥削的保护措施

sentences.en: technology that will safeguard the environment
The problem was to safeguard sites from encroachment by property development.
sentences.cn: 问题是要保护遗址免受房地产开发商的侵占。

sentences.en: They are taking precautionary measures to safeguard their forces from the effects of chemical weapons.
sentences.cn: 他们正采取预防措施保护其军队免受化学武器的伤害。

sentences.en: War was a sure safeguard of sanity.
sentences.cn: 战争是保持神志清醒的可靠保障.

sentences.en: Warm clothes help to safeguard against catching cold.
sentences.cn: 穿得暖和有助于预防感冒.

sentences.en: We have taken measures to safeguard our city from air attack.
sentences.cn: 我们已采取措施以防遭到空袭.

sentences.en: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.cn: 我们将实施一系列措施来更好地保护公众安全。

trans.tran_cn: 保护，保卫，防护措施，安全设施
trans.tran_en: a rule, agreement etc that is intended to protect someone or something from possible dangers or problems

trans.tran_cn: 维护, 保护, 捍卫
trans.tran_en: to protect something from harm or damage
to protect something from harm or damage
